questions.question: Who won the award for best supporting actor?
Who won the award for best supporting actress?
incorrectAnswers: Keira Knightley for The Imitation Game
Meryl Streep for Into the Woods

questions.question: What won for best animated feature film?
What won for best documentary feature?
Who won for best original screenplay?
incorrectAnswers: E Max Frye, Dan Futterman – Foxcatcher
Wes Anderson, Hugo Guinness – The Grand Budapest Hotel

questions.question: Who won for best director?
incorrectAnswers: Wes Anderson for The Grand Budapest Hotel
Morten Tyldum for The Imitation Game

questions.question: Who won for best actor?
questions.correctAnswer: Eddie Redmayne for The Theory of Everything
incorrectAnswers: Benedict Cumberbatch for The Imitation Game

topics.synopsis: Net migration to the UK is higher than when the coalition took office, shattering prime minister David Cameron’s ‘no ifs, no buts’ promise to cut the number. Learn more…

questions.question: In a speech to his party in April 2011, what did David Cameron promise his government would reduce net migration levels to?
questions.correctAnswer: In the order of tens of thousands each year
incorrectAnswers: No more than forty or fifty thousand a year

questions.question: What was net migration to the UK in 2014?
The latest net migration figures are the highest since which year?
Emigration has remained stable for the past two years - but at what level?
In 2014, what percentage of those coming to work in Britain came from within the EU?
